lines.text: How do I know you have six months to live?
We could sit here and wait.
Can you make money from philosophy?
Yeah, if you have the right one.
He's gonna go into philosophy.
Why?
'Cause that's what he wanted.
Who told you that?
Mr. Wittgenstein.
Who's Mr. Wittgenstein?
Mr. Parker.
Mr. Parker is Mr. Wittgenstein?
[doorbell rings]
Umm... oh... what did he tell you?... Look, don't go into uhh, what's his name's room. I think there's something severely wrong with him!
[doorbell again]
Uh, do you want me to get that?
It's the police!
Nevermind.
Michael, go do your homework...
[to Max]
There isn't something in his room that does his homework is there?

[looking at the new refrigerator]
It has an ice crusher!
Don't crush ice! Don't crush anything! It's a mistake! It doesn't belong to us!
My name isn't Parker.
Its not?
No. Its Wittgenstein.
Wittgenstein?
Gus Wittgenstein.
Maybe I'm your father, but you're not my daughter. Do you know what Kierkegaard once said?
Yes! And I'm not interested in any more of your roommates!

[Regarding the motorbike that Brian has loaned to her]
I don't have it anymore, it was stolen in the parking lot.
[Brian slowly starts to sink toward the ground]
But I told the police. I'm surprised they didn't tell you.
They tell me when other vehicles are stolen. They don't tell me when it's mine.

[Mike points the camcorder at Max]
No, Mike, not me.
Why not?
Well, certain primitive tribes believe that pictures steal your soul, and I don't have too much soul.
You've got enough dirty deals in your life. Don't turn your back on a payoff.
I have to go. I have to live my life. I have to appear calm and intelligent, I am dating a person. We will discuss this when I get home.
You won it.
What?
On a TV show.
I was never on a TV show!
It was one of those TV shows you don't have to be on. I was finishing up the breakfast dishes when there's a knock at the door , and in comes a lawyer with a blue suit...
No.
No?
No, no. I don't think I won this, I never won anything in my life. This is a mistake!
But it had your name and address on the invoice. I signed for you. Now, she'll probably have to go down and do a few publicity pictures but the stuff is yours.
Maybe it's on the six o'clock news!
It's not on the six o'clock news, just turn that off and put everything down... a man with a blue suit, huh?
Listen. I'm trying to keep so many people happy, all at the same time, and I'm not one of them. But don't give up on me. I'm worth it, I promise.
Did you leave the vehicle unlocked?
I just told you they broke into it last month. The locks didn't work.
On each side of the vehicle?
Why do you keep calling it a vehicle, it's hardly even a car.
Don't you watch TV? We all talk like that.

[about lost test papers]
I'm sorry, look at it this way. For those that passed, they're not going to have any trouble passing again, and for those that fail, who have an extra night to study.
Shit!
This is English, Luis, save that discussion for Biology.
Life hasn't been all that wonderful to you, has it Nora?
I take what comes along.
Well, why don't you take the good as well as the bad?
When it comes from the same place I get a little suspicious.
How do you know I'm Max Dugan?
You *told* me you were.
I told you a lot of things, but so far you haven't liked any of them, so I'll keep on telling new ones until you pick out one you like.

[about house remodeling]
They raise the teacher's salary this year?
No, no, no. I've been doing private tutoring in the evening.
Mm, who you tutoring, Arabs?
Who is the man living in your house?
What man?
This man.
[holding a picture of Max]
Mr. Parker. Does odd jobs, he tells me. Came 10 days ago wearing a black hat, black coat, carrying a black satchel. Mrs. Litke is more dependable than the CIA.
Can't you stop being a cop for five minutes and just be a friend?
No, that's why I don't have too many friends.
Well, if it's one less you want, you're doing a terrific job...
What if we went away together, all of us - to New Mexico, or Arizona. I could teach, get a job , just until...
And the detective?
He's more interested in getting his man than his woman.
You'd do that for me? Why?
I'd miss your pancakes in the morning.
You've grown into an extraordinary young woman, Nora, and *I* deserve all the credit. If I didn't abandoned you, *God* knows what would have happened to you?
The only thing I ever learned in jail was that it was a terrific place to stay out of.
Tell me something. Do you think I'm corrupt?
Aren't we all - just a little bit?

[cheering at ball game]
Come on, Michael! For Spinoza, Sophocles, Aristotle!
She doesn't even know the names of her own team.
[last lines]

[seeing the Mercedes drive by]
It that?
My God, he's gonna drive to Brazil.

[waving]
So long pop...
